intro: Rhynchospora atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense stands that help stabilize shorelines. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-lobed flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Rhynchospora atlantica plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
